de.piratenpartei.id.vote

Class Helper

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.piratenpartei.id.vote.Helper

  • public class Helper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the main work horse. It contains methods that compute hashes or transform keys to Strings etc. All methods are static. Hence, this class needs not be instantiated.
    Author:
    arne

      Helper()

    • Method Detail

      • readPublicKey

        public static java.security.PublicKey readPublicKey(java.lang.String modulus,
                                    java.lang.String exponent)
                                             throws IllegalFormatException
        Creates a public key from modulus and exponent given as strings in Base64 encoding. For precise description on the format of the strings see the protocol documentation. A RSA key is created.
        Parameters:
        modulus - the modulus of the RSA key.
        exponent - the exponent of the RSA key.
        Returns:
        the loaded public key
        Throws:
        IllegalFormatException - if something is not in the format as expected

      • writePublicKey

        public static void writePublicKey(java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
                  java.security.PublicKey pk)
                           throws KeyException
        Writes a public key with the specified string builder. This is the inverse operation of readPublicKey(String, String). It first writes a line "Modulus: <modulus>" and then writes a line "Exponent: <exponent>".
        Parameters:
        builder - the builder to write the result into
        pk - the public key to write
        Throws:
        KeyException - if the key is not a RSA-Key

      • computeHash

        public static java.lang.String computeHash(java.security.PublicKey pk)
                                    throws KeyException
        Computes the Hash of the specified key.
        Parameters:
        pk - the key for which to compute the hash.
        Returns:
        the computed hash
        Throws:
        KeyException - if the Key is not a RSA key

      • computeDigest

        public static java.lang.String computeDigest(java.lang.String text)
        Hashes the specified text and returns the computed digest
        Parameters:
        text - the text to hash
        Returns:
        the computed hash (digest)

      • computeSignature

        public static java.lang.String computeSignature(java.lang.String digest,
                                java.security.PrivateKey pk)
                                         throws KeyException
        Encrypts a given string with the specified private key.
        Parameters:
        digest - the text to encrypt
        pk - the private key to use
        Returns:
        the encoded string.
        Throws:
        KeyException

      • verifySignature

        public static boolean verifySignature(java.lang.String digest,
                      java.lang.String signature,
                      java.security.PublicKey pk)
                               throws KeyException
        Verifies a signature. Decodes signature using the specified public key and checks if the result equals digest.
        Parameters:
        digest - the digest to verify against
        signature - the signature string to decode
        pk - the public key for decoding
        Returns:
        true iff verified.
        Throws:
        KeyException - if the given key is not a RSA-key

      • verifyKey

        public static void verifyKey(java.security.PublicKey pk,
             java.lang.String hash)
                      throws KeyException
        Checks, if the given hash is really the hash of the specified key.
        Parameters:
        pk - the key to verify
        hash - the hash to verify
        Throws:
        KeyException - if the hash doesn't match to the key.

      • read

        public static java.lang.String read(java.lang.String identifier,
                    java.lang.String text)
                             throws IllegalFormatException
        Reads a line of a input file. The line must have the format: [identifier]:[value] The identifier must not contain any colons. The value must not contain any colons. If it does not have this format, an IllegalFormatException is thrown. Whitespace around value is trimmed away.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier with which the line has to start
        text - the text of the complete line
        Returns:
        the value part of the line (the text following the colon)
        Throws:
        IllegalFormatException

      • initKeyStore

        public static void initKeyStore(char[] password)
                         throws KeyException
        Creates a new empty Keystore. If a keystore already existed, the old keystore is overwritten.
        Parameters:
        password - the password with which to protect the keystore.
        Throws:
        KeyException
